@graph.name: Juicy Slow Cooker Turkey Breast | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: This slow cooker turkey breast is the ONLY guaranteed way to ensure turkey breast comes out juicy! 5 minutes prep - and served with a beautiful gravy!

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Juicy Slow Cooker Turkey Breast
@graph.description: RECIPE VIDEO above. I've tried a handful of other methods over the years. This has produced the juiciest turkey breast by far, without brining the breast in advance. Plus slow cooking is very forgiving so you don't need to be spot on with the cooking time. SCALE RECIPE by moving slider on Servings to adjust for different turkey weights. Complete your feast - browse the new Thanksgiving Recipe Index!
recipeIngredient: 2 kg / 4 lb  turkey breast, skin on, bone in or boneless (if using frozen, thaw it) (Note 1)
1  head of garlic, cut in half horizontally
1  onion (brown, yellow or white), unpeeled, cut in half
5  sprigs of thyme (or 2 tsp dried thyme leaves)
Chicken stock/broth (or water), for topping up liquid (see Gravy step 1)

recipeInstructions.text: Place Rub ingredients in a bowl and mix to combine, it should be a wet paste.
recipeInstructions.name: Place Rub ingredients in a bowl and mix to combine, it should be a wet paste.

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the turkey dry all over with paper towels. Slather with the Rub, using most for the side and top.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat the turkey dry all over with paper towels. Slather with the Rub, using most for the side and top.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the garlic, onion and thyme face down in the slow cooker. Place the turkey breast on top so it is elevated.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the garlic, onion and thyme face down in the slow cooker. Place the turkey breast on top so it is elevated.

recipeInstructions.text: Slow Cook on LOW for 6 hours (do not use high) or until internal temperature reads 165F/75C when thermometer is inserted into the middle. Check internal temperature at 5 hours if you can. (To roast, follow this recipe).
recipeInstructions.name: Slow Cook on LOW for 6 hours (do not use high) or until internal temperature reads 165F/75C when thermometer is inserted into the middle. Check internal temperature at 5 hours if you can. (To roast, follow this recipe).

recipeInstructions.text: Remove turkey from the slow cooker (do not leave in slow cooker on Warm setting) and let it rest for 20 minutes before crisping the skin.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove turkey from the slow cooker (do not leave in slow cooker on Warm setting) and let it rest for 20 minutes before crisping the skin.

itemListElement.text: Place an oven shelf 30cm / 1 foot from the heat source.
itemListElement.name: Place an oven shelf 30cm / 1 foot from the heat source.

itemListElement.text: Remove turkey breast from the slow cooker into a heatproof serving dish.
itemListElement.name: Remove turkey breast from the slow cooker into a heatproof serving dish.

itemListElement.text: Place on the oven shelf and broil for 3 to 5 minutes until the skin is crispy. Keep an eye on it - it browns very quickly!
itemListElement.name: Place on the oven shelf and broil for 3 to 5 minutes until the skin is crispy. Keep an eye on it - it browns very quickly!

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately with gravy on the side.
itemListElement.name: Serve immediately with gravy on the side.

itemListElement.text: Strain the liquid into a measuring jug, squishing the garlic etc to extract all the flavour. If you are short of 2 cups, top up with chicken broth (I usually get 2 cups of liquid from a 4 lb / 2 kg turkey breast).
itemListElement.name: Strain the liquid into a measuring jug, squishing the garlic etc to extract all the flavour. If you are short of 2 cups, top up with chicken broth (I usually get 2 cups of liquid from a 4 lb / 2 kg turkey breast).

itemListElement.text: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and mix to combine. Pour about 1/2 cup of liquid into the flour mixture and mix until it forms a paste. Slowly add remaining liquid, stirring as your go. Use a whisk if required to make the gravy smooth. Simmer until thickened - take it off before it is as thick as you want because it will continue to thicken.
itemListElement.name: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and mix to combine. Pour about 1/2 cup of liquid into the flour mixture and mix until it forms a paste. Slowly add remaining liquid, stirring as your go. Use a whisk if required to make the gravy smooth. Simmer until thickened - take it off before it is as thick as you want because it will continue to thicken.

itemListElement.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with turkey.
itemListElement.name: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with turkey.

@graph.keywords: Slow Cooker Turkey Breast, Turkey Breast
